moves.22... Rxe2 23. Rxe2 g6:
Perhaps black wanted to avoid the variation: 23... Nxg3 
24. Nxg3 Qxg3 25. Nc6 Rf8 26. d6 Ne6 27. d7 h6 
28. Rxe6!  fxe6 29. d8=Q Rxd8 30. Rxd8+ +/=
moves.24. f4 Nf6 25. Nc6 Rd7 26. Ne5 Rd8 27. N:
!+/=
Otherwise black must offer the draw.
moves.29. Nxd7 Nxd7:
?
Wrong choise.
Better was: 29..., Qxd7 30. d6, Nc5 31. Re7 Qxa4 and the black 
pieces seem to stand better.
Black is helpless.
Neither 33..., Nc5 saves the position. It would follow: 34.Bd5!
moves.34. d7:
Also good is: 34. Rc7!  (If 34…, Qd8, then 35.d7, Qxc7 
36.d8=Q, Qxd8 37.Rxd8 +-)
moves.35... Kf8:
Alternative variation: 35... Nxg4+ 36. hxg4, Qxe7 
37. d8=Q, Qxd8 38.Rxd8, Nc5 39. Bc6 +-
moves.36. Ne5:
Coup de grace!
Black cannot take the Rook and must resign.
moves.36... Nc5:
It would follow 37.Rxf7+ and 38.Rxf6+-

But fate decided otherwise...
